medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with recurrent RUQ pain for a week, with 4 episodes of RUQ/epigastric pain, each lasting several hours. Pain began around 12:30 AM on the morning of presentation and persisted longer than prior attacks, prompting an emergency department visit. Each attack was described as moderate to severe, occurring at night and accompanied by mild shortness of breath, nausea, chills, and non-bloody emesis on 2 occasions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoarthritis, Recurrent sinus infections, Dermatologic condition treated with topical Ketoconazole, History of left total hip replacement approximately 2 months ago.
